intro: Preonanthus sulfureus, commonly known as the golden sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and compact, drought-tolerant growth habit. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in arid landscapes. Preonanthus sulfureus is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
